Edited awe preprocessing wrapper so that if a file is submitted to the p...

Edited awe preprocessing wrapper so that if a file is submitted to the pipeline without seq_length_stats.py having been run, and filter_ln flag has been set, it will go ahead and calculate min_ln and max_ln so those options will be set before preprocessing is executed.

make all of the objects use relative paths (#3)

if they use absolute paths on windows, we can end up with a makefile
rule that looks like this:

Keyword.o C:\...\CallParser.a : ...

and make gets confused by that first colon.
refactor this to make it easier to modify
NavCore::Controller - now also detects/redirects browser GETs to '#!'

Role::Controller: direct browser GET requests auto redirect

Direct browser GET requests (i.e. not Ajax requests from within the
ExtJS client) to RapidApp 'Modules' now auto redirect to a hashnav (#!)
URL (to force it to open in RapidApp tab)

v1.004

  - Change dependency from Digest::SHA1 to Digest::SHA
switch dependency from Digest::SHA1 to Digest::SHA

Added logging to anvil_setup, added a cleaner way to exit. Removed the need to ack each time a cable is unplugged during the remapping process.

Signed-off-by: digimer <digimer@alteeve.ca>

Added some sanity checks, cleaned up so bad/changed package names and cleaned up the output.

Signed-off-by: digimer <digimer@alteeve.ca>

Changes the NTP configuration option to default to 'yes'.

Signed-off-by: digimer <digimer@alteeve.ca>

Removed the 'install_bu' switch because it wasn't reliable, for reasons that I am too blind to see today. Fixed a bug in searching for the RPMs that need to be installed.

Signed-off-by: digimer <digimer@alteeve.ca>
SCUBA2: add support for logging results from two-component fits

SCUBA2: add support for fitting two gaussians

With this update, calibration sources will have be fitted for two
gaussian components with an amplitude ratio and initial FWHM given by
the empirically-derived values.

This may be overly broad and a signal-to-noise threshold might be
needed in future.

SCUBA2: restore correct WCS to thresholded file if necessary

Copybad trims pixel axes from the target file if they're not present
in the template. In the case where the 2-d exposure time image is to
be used for thresholding, the 3rd pixel axis must be added and the
original WCS copied over from the input file.

Item12559: fixed EXPAND messing around with the current topic context

Improve the README file

Tool to apply current auto-delete threshold retroactively

Use with caution!
Quick lightweight tool to gather spam report stats

Use the first active status instead of hardcoding "open"

More flexibility for lifecycles.
Don't try to delete already deleted tickets

Usage notes in the doc

README directly instead of the POD.

v0.020

	* Drop Perl6::Junction in favor of Syntax::Keyword::Junction Same
	  thing -- essentially, AFAICT -- except that we don't get 'smartmatch
	  operator is experimental' warnings in 5.18 :)

Perl6::Junction => Syntax::Keyword::Junction

Same thing -- essentially, AFAICT -- except that we don't get 'smartmatch
operator is experimental' warnings in 5.18 :)

Allow bisect-prove to be run from a subdirectory

Normally, git-bisect expects to be run from the toplevel
directory. You can now run it from an arbitrary subdirectory,
provided that the directory exists in all commits.

This now requires File::pushd.

The script will die if there is a git error.
